metadata.title: CVE-2016-6171 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
Knot DNS before 2.3.0 allows remote DNS servers to cause a denial of service (memory exhaustion and slave server crash) via a large zone transfer for (1) DDNS, (2) AXFR, or (3) IXFR.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2016-6171` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

knot - 2.3.0-1
knot-dnsutils - 2.3.0-1
knot-host - 2.3.0-1
knot-module-dnstap - 2.3.0-1
knot-module-geoip - 2.3.0-1
libdnssec8 - 2.3.0-1
libknot11 - 2.3.0-1
libzscanner3 - 2.3.0-1
python3-libknot - 2.3.0-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: knot package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.3.0-1').
